intro: Erythrochilus minor, commonly known as the small red-lip orchid, is a species of flowering plant in the orchid family. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers with a distinctive red lip. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Erythrochilus minor is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific environmental conditions to thrive.
